1.Pros: It gave me a good opportunity to work with the people and realize that I enjoy customer service. It was a good place for a 1st time job.
1.Cons: Sometimes my supervisor lacked the skills to handle his job. He was promoted too quickly and the job was overwhelming to him.

2.Pros: Get to meet a lot of people and learn how to deal with different people
2.Cons: nothing negative i can really say about it :)

3.Summary: "Flexible schedules, highly organized system of management, opportunities to grow as a person, and (for some) advance."
3.Pros: I love the fact that I can choose my own hours and leave time free to pursue other interests in my free time.
3.Cons: The pay is not great. It is not an intellectually stimulating environment if you are looking for that.

4.Pros: Good hours, nice people, and good benefits.
4.Cons: Hard work, dirty environment, and bad customers.

5.Cons: My sister was manager for 25 years and took advantage of free meals. But she died at 63 from coronary problems. Her doctor said her veins/arteries looked like they were filled with coral. Of course she smoked too.

6.Cons: Bad management style in the main office.

7.Pros: You get a free meal with every shift you work over 4-5 hours and an employee discount of half off. Crew members are usually really great and fun.
7.Cons: The customers can be extremely rude and disrespectful and your employee discount can only be used at your place of employment

8.Cons: I hated working with the employees and higher powers.

9.Pros: welcoming staff and was willing to work with my schedule
9.Cons: busy environment, must be willing to work
